synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves mixing lithium sulfide, diphosphorus pentasulfide, germanium sulfide, and lithium bromide in specified proportions in an argon-filled glove box, milling the mixture in a zirconia pot with zirconia balls for 40 hours, then calcining the resulting amorphized ion conductive material in a quartz tube under vacuum, increasing the temperature to 400°C over 6 hours, holding at 400°C for 8 hours, and slowly cooling to room temperature to obtain a sulfide solid electrolyte material with the composition 0.11(LiBr).(Li3.35Ge0.35P0.65S4).
